description.raw:
This is a graft from the spielman fork, which I've done my best to isolate from other changes I'll make a separate pull request for.

This change introduces a 'default baudrate' setting for the Novatech. Basically, this is the baud rate you expect the Novatech to be in when you power it on, and when you don't have one of the models where you can change a jumper to make them always at the fastest speed.
If you use this setting, the novatech will be told at startup to switch from its default baudrate to the one BLACS will actually talk to it with, and then the serial connection restarted with the new baudrate. Then at shutdown, the novatech is set back to its default baudrate, which is also nice if you don't want to confuse other software that needs to talk to the novatech and has expectations about its baudrate.
